data.title: History of July 16: List of Important events
data.meta_description: A glimpse of the day is highlighted to show the major discoveries and challenges that took place on this day.
data.text:
Here is all you need to know about important national and international events

The discoveries and challenges that took place on 16 July are enlisted. Showcasing the important highlights of the day with the major contribution of the leaders and rulers.

What happened on 16 July? History and famous personalities

On this day, 1377, King Richard II crowned, England

History – International

Events

1377, King Richard II crowned in England

On July 16, 1377, Richard II, also referred as Richard of Bordeaux, was King of England from 1377-1399. Richard’s father, Edward, Prince of Wales, died in 1376 made Richard the next king.

1661, the first banknotes, Europe

On July 16, 1661, the first true banknotes from Europe were issued in Sweden in 1661. Officials believed that paper money will downgrade the economic conditions.

1940, Adolf Hilter started preparation for Invasion of Britain

On July 16, 1940, The Battle of Britain in World War II was between Britain’s Royal Air Force (RAF) and the Luftwaffe, Nazi Germany’s air force, and was the first battle in history fought in the air.

1990, Philippines President Marcos

On July 16, 1990, Ferdinand Marcos was a Filipino politician who was the tenth President of the Philippines from 1965 to 1986. Marcos reformed the laws and constitution system.

1979, Iraq Saddam Hussein

On July 16, 1979, Saddam Hussein took oath and charge of the President. Hussein was born in Iraq and during his incumbent role; he started changing the Baghdad terror.

Read more: What happened on 13 July? History and famous personalities

Births- International

Painter Joshua Reynolds

Born on July 16, 1723, Sir Joshua Reynolds was an English painter, specializing in portraits. Joshua was one of the biggest painters in the late 18th Century.

President Cyrus Griffin

Born on July 16, 1748, Cyrus Griffin was the last President of the Congress and a Judge in the District Court of Virginia.

Golfer John Maxwell

Born on July 16, 1871, John Maxwell was an American golfer from Illinois. Maxwell was a popular player and earned several awards.

Actor Percy Kilbride

Born on July 16, 1888, Percy William Kilbride was an American character actor. He made a career of playing country hicks; Percy did voice-overs for major series.

Actor Mary Philbin

Born on July 16, 1902, Mary Philbin was an American actress who had a huge fan following since her childhood. She gained popularity after a theatre show in Chicago.

History – Indian

Events

2001, India Pakistan Kashmir turmoil

On July 16, 2001, In India the leaders of India and Pakistan failed to reach on a decision of their 50-year dispute over Kashmir, ending a landmark three-day summit on a solemn note.

2002, Grenade wounded 13

On July 16, 2002, In Indian Controlled Kashmir, a grenade from the neighbouring border hit the Indian ground and causalities 0f more than 13 were reported.

2003, Himachal Pradesh Floods

On July 16, 2003, a number of more than 100 people died due to the flash floods caused by heavy rains in the states of Himachal Pradesh.

2008, Land mines in Orissa

On July 16, 2008, the rebels in Orissa state planted land mines where the vehicle of 20 special commando officers came in contact and got exploded.

2012, Sex Determination in India

On July 16, 2012, Indian officials suspended 12 doctors for allegedly conducting prenatal sex tests, a practice banned to stop the abortion of female fetuses that has widened India’s gender gap.

Births – Indian

Actor Shringar Nagaraj

Born on July 16, 1939, Shringar Nagaraj was a multi-talented Kannada Actor, cameraman, and a producer of silent movies.

Cricketer Venkatraman Subramanya

Born on July 16, 1936, Venkatraman Subramanya is a former Indian cricketer. Subramanya was born in Mysore, he is a middle-order batsman and a leg spinner.

Hockey Player Dhanraj Pillay

Born on July 16, 1968, Dhanraj Pillay is a retired Indian Hockey player and was a captain of India Hockey team.
